src

Interface DoWithCommand


  • public interface DoWithCommand
    A simple interface to represent a possible action to be taken when the user enters "do something with" and a file name.
    Author:
    Nate Young

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(Frederic f, java.io.File file)
      Performs the action this DoCommandWith represents.
      boolean supports(java.lang.String ext)
      Returns whether this DoWithCommand can be used with a file with the given file extension.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(Frederic f,
             java.io.File file)
        Performs the action this DoCommandWith represents.
        Implementing classes should write the behavior of the intended action into this method.
        Parameters:
        f - The Frederic that called the method (for reading/printing purposes)
        file - The File that the user specified should be used. This is guaranteed to be one of the filetypes that this DoWithCommand has specified that it supports.

      • supports

        boolean supports(java.lang.String ext)
        Returns whether this DoWithCommand can be used with a file with the given file extension.
        Implementing classes should use this method to specify to the program what filetypes this command should be run with.
        Parameters:
        ext - The file extension to be checked
        Returns:
        Whether this DoWithCommand can use files with the given file extension
